title: Web Development Practical Competency Enhancement: Dynamic Dual Learning Model Design Based on Image Denoising

context.prior_knowledge: Linear Algebra, Probability Theory, Basic Deep Learning Concepts, and Python Programming
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for IT/Software Development Professionals

learning_goals: Comparative analysis and application of residual/non-residual learning methods for image restoration under various noise levels.
Implementation and optimization of attention mechanisms for dynamic feature map learning.
Design and evaluation of a fusion model capable of handling multiple noise levels with a single network.

Learners can compare and analyze three or more denoising techniques (e.g., Non-local Means, BM3D, deep learning-based methods) on real image datasets (e.g., noisy CIFAR-10 version) during a 2–4-week mid-term course, propose optimal solutions through project reports, and achieve over 70 points on the evaluation rubric (40% technical accuracy, 30% implementation completeness, 30% creativity).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
